title: The pattern behind self-deception - Michael Shermer

options.label: D

options.text: They are based on a desire for power and control

options.label: D
options.text: They are based on a fear of the unknown

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: It is easily fooled by conflicting data

options.label: D
options.text: It is influenced by our expectations and beliefs

options.label: C
options.text: Dopamine has no effect on creativity

options.label: D
options.text: Dopamine only affects creativity in certain situations

multiple-choice.question: What is the main idea of the speaker's talk?

options.label: A
options.text: Our brains are wired to detect patterns, and this can lead to superstition and conspiracy theories

options.label: B
options.text: Our brains are wired to be skeptical, and this can lead to a lack of creativity

options.label: C
options.text: Our brains are wired to believe in invisible beings, and this can lead to a lack of control

options.label: D
options.text: Our brains are wired to detect patterns, and this can lead to a greater understanding of the world
